Exel Fontana Scotts Emergency Action Plan

Purpose:
The purpose of this Emergency Action Plan (EAP) is to present in general outline form, an organized plan that should be followed in the event of an emergency situation.

Scope:
This Emergency Action Plan applies to all occupants of this facility.  (Exel Associates, Contract Workers, Visitors and Vendors)

Procedure:
Emergency Response Signaling
Emergency Response Signaling can be done by one of two methods: air horns and word of mouth.  Emitting a sequence of blasts from an air horn will be the primary means of Emergency Response Signaling.

The Emergency Response Signaling Sequence will be as follows:

Fire Emergency		= 	Long Blast-----Short Blast-----Long Blast
(Sequence of blast will stop for 4 seconds and sequence of blast will sound again.)

Spill Emergency		=	Short Blast---Short Blast---Short Blast
(Sequence of blast will stop for 4 seconds and sequence of blast will sound again.)

Earthquake/Tornado Emergency	=	Long Continuous Blast.

If the Emergency Response Signaling Horns are malfunctioning or are found not to be effective, the ¿Person in Charge¿ must notify other facility occupants of the emergency situation and give them instructions.  ¿Person in Charge¿ must utilize telephone, radio or send Associate to facility location, which is not receiving the Emergency Response Horn signal.

2	Process Safety Management Program

2.1 	Process Safety Information

The manufacturer of the product, OM Scotts, has provided the process safety information and handling procedures to Exel. The Exel Fontana Scotts location will adopt the OM Scotts storage and handling procedure. Furthermore, all current site associates will undergo instruction reference the safe handling and storage of products containing Propane as prescribed by OM Scotts.


OM Scotts  -  Storage and Handling Information

Product: Aerosols containing Propane
Package Type: Steel aerosol cans
Approximate Gross Weight: 14 ounces each.
Approximate Empty Weight: ~ 4 ounces.

Aerosol cans are packaged in fiberboard boxes (6 ¿ 12 per box).  Boxes will arrive and be shipped on wooden pallets secured by plastic shrink wrapping.  All shipments will be moved by enclosed van trailers.

Storage area must be segregated and have containment (i.e. caged areas or cutoff rooms).

This material is listed hazardous substance per EPA RMP 112(r) with a threshold quantity of 10,000lbs.

Storage should be in accordance with NFPA 30B for Level III aerosols.  Do not store near flames, sparks or hot surfaces.  Exposure to heat or prolonged exposure to the sun may cause the container to burst.  The container should not be punctured, incinerated or stored above 130 degrees F.


Center for Chemical Process Safety (CCPS) Propane Warehouse Safety


Warehouse associates are to be shown new containers and how to identify by markings and labels

Exel shall notify its associates of all hazards associated with this product and provide employees sufficient training to include MSDS and product safety bulletins.

Storage area should be selected to provide for adequate fire suppression and containment (i.e. cage

d areas or cutoff rooms if applicable) while not restricting or blocking emergency exits.

The Site Safety Committee will be an on-going committee. Membership will be composed of two associates per shift, one maintenance representative, and one manager or supervisor. The manger or supervisor shall chair the committee. One associate and the chair will represent the committee as members of the Exel Regional Safety Council

¿	Membership should be voluntary.
¿	Once an associate becomes a committee member, meeting attendance is mandatory.
¿	Member effectiveness and participation should be evaluated every six months. 
¿	Member rotation is encouraged every two years.
¿	Once a member leaves his or her posit

ion they should be replaced with in one month. 

Responsibilities

1.	Conduct weekly: 1-facility audit and 1-behavior audit. Ensure items/deficiencies identified are addressed. Create summary spreadsheet and post audit findings and corrective actions. Every committee member should conduct an audit on a rotating schedule. Provide this information to the Exel Regional Safety Council.

2.	Assist Team Leaders when conducting incident investigations. Present investigative derived root causes and action items to safety committee. Ensure all actions items have been addressed 

3.	Review incidents from the previous month. Formulate summary spreadsheet with accident/incident description and lessons learned. Post information in conspicuous location (i.e. break room). Provide this information to the Exel Regional Safety Council.

4.	Monitor facility BLS rate and related performance. Set performance objectives related to this information. Institute programs designed to improve safety performance.

5.	Identify safety-related deficiencies, and propose corrective actions.

6.	Facilitate site safety training. Ensure training is up-to-date.

7.	Members shall serve as a voice and an example for associates.

8.	Manage site safety programs; safety bingo, safety slogan contest, safety dinners, etc. Monitor effectiveness of various safety programs.

9.	Members should receive periodic specialty training;

¿	OSHA 10 Hour 
¿	Accident/Incident Investigation
¿	CPR/First Aid & Emergency Response
¿	Audit Process and Procedure

10.	Post safety-meeting minutes in a conspicuous location.



Frequency and Duration of Meetings

¿	Meetings will be held on a monthly basis, the same time and date each month is recommended.
¿	Meetings will last no more than one hour without consensus agreement of members present.
